title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Olympian Pita Taufatofua of Tonga used GoFundMe to raise money for his tsunami-ravaged nation. How many islands does it comprise?

A. 17

B. 170

C. 1,700

D. 17,000

---

2. The yield on 10-year German government bonds did something for the first time since 2019. What was it?

A. Turned positive

B. Turned negative

C. Exceeded the 10-year Treasury yield

D. Fell below the 30-year Treasury yield

---

3. Microsoft agreed to buy Activision Blizzard in a deal worth $75 billion. Which of these is among Activision's games?

A. Call of Duty

B. Candy Crush

C. World of Warcraft

D. All of the above

---

4. The bankruptcy of a Philadelphia hospital raised the problem of what to do with a patient who has . . .

A. A plutonium-powered pacemaker

B. Unpaid medical bills of nearly $4 million

C. Nowhere to go when the hospital closes

D. Forgotten the password to an implanted defibrillator

---

5. Incurable "citrus greening" is taking a toll on Florida's orange crop. How is the disease spread?

A. Tree lice

B. Leaf mites

C. Citrus blight

D. Unvaccinated groves

---

6. Arizona State University aims to expand online. How many new students does it hope to enroll?

A. 100,000

B. 1 million

C. 10 million

D. 100 million

---

7. Turkey agreed to a currency swap worth nearly $5 billion with the United Arab Emirates -- whose currency is called what?

A. The dalasi

B. The dinar

C. The dirham

D. The dollar

---

8. New research has identified something that impairs the sense of smell guiding bees and butterflies in pollination. What's the culprit?

A. Covid

B. Air pollution

C. Pesticides

D. Anomalous weather events

---

ANSWERS

1. B

2. A

3. D

4. A

5. A

6. D

7. C

8. B
